intro: Gnaphalium acuminatissimum, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
